posts.post_content: For 1 mana, you get to either mill your opponents OR feed your graveyard? Well I think it has more to show than what is apparent at first glance! I think it's a great card... Looking forward to (ab)using it! :-P

Posted By: masterSDF (9/27/2009 4:52:39 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Can both be of great use either for milling your or your opponent's side.  
Given that this is in your opening hand and survives, it greatly sums up to the lategame. When you play your sixth land this crab has milled considerable fifteen cards, that's one [Tome Scour](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tome Scour) plus one [Glimpse the Unthinkable](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Glimpse the Unthinkable).  
  
I also like the fact that it has a 0/2 body.  
It suits to Crabs regarding flavor, blocks 1/x creatures unharmed and prevents it from getting [Zap](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Zap)ped to death that easily.
posts.html:

I also like the fact that it has a 0/2 body.
It suits to Crabs regarding flavor, blocks 1/x creatures unharmed and prevents it from getting Zapped to death that easily.

Posted By: Mode (9/27/2009 11:04:46 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
yes, it is great for milling, but in a way I wish they wouldn't encourage milling quite as much as they do, because then your not getting to play your simply getting all your cards milled and the game ends. I've been on both sides of the card mill deck in play and it can win for you (memory erosion being an especially awesome card) but it also takes a lot of the fun out of it. Doesn't quite feel like winning because you never let your opponent play anything for a whole game with some mill, remove soul, essence scatter, and counter spells, so its like playing solitaire until you win. Great for spikes, but I'm more of a johnny.. timmyish.. somewhere in between, I still like to win, but I'd rather not have to lock down my opponent entirely to do it.
  
   
Drawing all 4 archive traps in your starting hand for example.. can mill your opponents entire deck except for 8 right at the beginning for 0 mana.
  
   
Anyways, sort of rambling here, just making a case for and against milling, its a go... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Drawing all 4 archive traps in your starting hand for example.. can mill your opponents entire deck except for 8 right at the beginning for 0 mana.

Anyways, sort of rambling here, just making a case for and against milling, its a go... (see all)

Posted By: Designer_Genes (9/26/2009 1:09:22 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I'm not a fan of mill, but the excuse that it doesn't let you play things is so stupid. How is getting milled any different than just plain killed? Instead of dealing 20 damage, they mill 50 cards. It's certainly harder to combat, but that isn't the fault of the people playing the mill decks.  
  
That said, while I have a mill deck, I don't play it much. While in multiplayer it can all but instantly take someone out, it seems a bit unsporting. Yes, [Traumatize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Traumatize) + [Mind Funeral](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Funeral) + [Tome Scour](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tome Scour) is pretty nice, getting a 40 card deck down to about 5 cards, it isn't fun to get hit with. It's a legitimate tactic, but it just isn't that fun to play against.  
  
And as for 4x [Archive Trap](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Archive Trap) in the first hand, for a 60 card deck, they are dead second turn. They already drew 7, and you milled them for 52. A 1 card library doesn't last long.
posts.html:
I'm not a fan of mill, but the excuse that it doesn't let you play things is so stupid. How is getting milled any different than just plain killed? Instead of dealing 20 damage, they mill 50 cards. It's certainly harder to combat, but that isn't the fault of the people playing the mill decks.

That said, while I have a mill deck, I don't play it much. While in multiplayer it can all but instantly take someone out, it seems a bit unsporting. Yes, Traumatize + Mind Funeral + Tome Scour is pretty nice, getting a 40 card deck down to about 5 cards, it isn't fun to get hit with. It's a legitimate tactic, but it just isn't that fun to play against.

And as for 4x Archive Trap in the first hand, for a 60 card deck, they are dead second turn. They already drew 7, and you milled them for 52. A 1 card library doesn't last long.
